content.text:
Tabbed by: Emrldeyzs
CAPO 2

[Verse]
[ch]Am[/ch]                         [ch]E7[/ch]
  On a dark desert highway, cool wind in my hair
[ch]G[/ch]                      [ch]D[/ch]
  Warm smell of colitas rising up through the air
[ch]F[/ch]                          [ch]C[/ch]
  Up ahead in the distance, I saw a shimmering light
[ch]Dm[/ch]
   My head grew heavy and my sight grew dim
[ch]E[/ch]
  I had to stop for the night

[ch]Am[/ch]                               [ch]E7[/ch]
  There she stood in the doorway; I heard the mission bell
[ch]G[/ch]
  And I was thinking to myself
              [ch]D[/ch]
This could be heaven or this could be hell
[ch]F[/ch]                          [ch]C[/ch]
  Then she lit up a candle, and she showed me the way
[ch]Dm[/ch]
   There were voices down the corridor,
[ch]E[/ch]
  I thought I heard them say...

[Chorus]
[ch]F[/ch]                          [ch]C[/ch]
  Welcome to the Hotel California.
       [ch]E7[/ch]                                          [ch]Am[/ch]
Such a lovely place, (such a lovely place), such a lovely face
        [ch]F[/ch]                               [ch]C[/ch]
There's plenty of room at the Hotel California
    [ch]Dm[/ch]                                       [ch]E[/ch]
Any time of year, (any time of year) You can find it here

[Verse]
[ch]Am[/ch]                            [ch]E7[/ch]
 Her mind is Tiffany-twisted, She got the Mercedes bends
[ch]G[/ch]                                    [ch]D[/ch]
 She got a lot of pretty pretty boys   she calls friends
[ch]F[/ch]                                   [ch]C[/ch]
  How they danced in the courtyard, sweet summer sweat
[ch]Dm[/ch]                       [ch]E[/ch]
  Some dance to remember, some dance to forget

[ch]Am[/ch]                           [ch]E7[/ch]
  So I called up the captain; Please bring me my wine (he said)
[ch]G[/ch]                                     [ch]D[/ch]
 We haven't had that spirit here since 1969
[ch]F[/ch]                                         [ch]C[/ch]
  and still those voices are calling from far away
[ch]Dm[/ch]
   Wake you up in the middle of the night 
[ch]E[/ch]
  Just to hear them say...

[Chorus]
[ch]F[/ch]                         [ch]C[/ch]
 Welcome to the Hotel California.
       [ch]E7[/ch]                                          [ch]Am[/ch]
Such a lovely place, (such a lovely place), such a lovely face
        [ch]F[/ch]                             [ch]C[/ch]
They're livin' it up at the Hotel California
       [ch]Dm[/ch]                                               [ch]E[/ch]
What a nice surprise, (what a nice surprise) Bring your alibis

[Verse]
[ch]Am[/ch]                        [ch]E7[/ch]
   Mirrors on the ceiling; the pink champagne on ice (and she said)
[ch]G[/ch]                                [ch]D[/ch]
  We are all just prisoners here, of our own device
[ch]F[/ch]                              [ch]C[/ch]
  and in the master's chambers, they gathered for the feast
[ch]Dm[/ch]
 They stab it with their steely knives but they
[ch]E[/ch]
just can't kill the beast

[ch]Am[/ch]                             [ch]E7[/ch]
   Last thing I remember, I was running for the door
[ch]G[/ch]                                       [ch]D[/ch]
  I had to find the passage back to the place I was before
[ch]F[/ch]                                   [ch]C[/ch]
  "Relax" said the night man; we are programmed to receive
[ch]Dm[/ch]
  You can check out any time you like
[ch]E[/ch]
 But you can never leave...

Hotel California - The Eagles

[Verse]

[ch]A[/ch]                     [ch]E7[/ch]
Warm smell of colitas rising up through the air
[ch]G[/ch]                         [ch]D[/ch]
Up ahead in the distance, I saw a shimmering light
[ch]Em[/ch]                                        [ch]F#7[/ch]
My head grew heavy and my sight grew dim; I had to stop for the night.

[ch]Bm[/ch]                              [ch]F#7[/ch]
There she stood in the doorway; I heard the mission bell
[ch]A[/ch]                                            [ch]E7[/ch]
And I was thinking to myself, "This could be Heaven or this could be Hell"
[ch]G[/ch]                        [ch]D[/ch]
Then she lit up a candle and she showed me the way
[ch]Em[/ch]                                  [ch]F#7[/ch]
There were voices down the corridor I thought I heard them say...


[Chorus]

[ch]G[/ch]                        [ch]D[/ch] 
Welcome to the Hotel California... 
       [ch]F#7[/ch]                                      [ch]Bm[/ch]        [ch]F#7[/ch](on [ch]C#[/ch])[ch]Bm[/ch](on [ch]D[/ch])
Such a lovely place,(such a lovely place)such a lovely face...
[ch]G[/ch]                               [ch]D[/ch]
Plenty of room at the Hotel California... 
    [ch]Em[/ch]                                     [ch]F#7[/ch]
Any time of year,(any time of year)you can find it here...


[Verse]

[ch]Bm[/ch]                           [ch]F#7[/ch]
Her mind is Tiffany-twisted, she got the Mercedes Bends
[ch]A[/ch]                                     [ch]E7[/ch]
She got a lot of pretty, pretty boys, that she calls friends
[ch]G[/ch]                                [ch]D[/ch]
How they dance in the courtyard, sweet summer sweat
[ch]Em[/ch]                      [ch]F#7[/ch]
Some dance to remember, some dance to forget

[ch]Bm[/ch]                           [ch]F#7[/ch]
So I called up the Captain, "Please bring me my wine"
          [ch]A[/ch]                                     [ch]E7[/ch]
He said, "We haven't had that spirit here since nineteen sixty nine"
[ch]G[/ch]                                       [ch]D[/ch]
And still those voices are calling from far away,
[ch]Em[/ch]                                     [ch]F#7[/ch]
Wake you up in the middle of the night just to hear them say...


[Chorus]

[ch]G[/ch]                        [ch]D[/ch] 
Welcome to the Hotel California... 
       [ch]F#7[/ch]                                      [ch]Bm[/ch]        [ch]F#7[/ch](on [ch]C#[/ch])[ch]Bm[/ch](on [ch]D[/ch])
Such a lovely place,(such a lovely place)such a lovely face...
[ch]G[/ch]                                  [ch]D[/ch]
They livin' it up at the Hotel California... 
       [ch]Em[/ch]                                             [ch]F#7[/ch]
What a nice surprise,(what a nice surprise)bring your alibis...


[Verse]

[ch]Bm[/ch]                      [ch]F#7[/ch]
Mirrors on the ceiling, the pink champagne on ice
              [ch]A[/ch]                               [ch]E7[/ch]
And she said "We are all just prisoners here, of our own device"
[ch]G[/ch]
And in the master's chambers, they gathered for the feast
[ch]Em[/ch]
They stab it with their steely knives, but they just can't kill the beast

[ch]Bm[/ch]                           [ch]F#7[/ch]
Last thing I remember, I was running for the door
[ch]A[/ch]                                 [ch]E7[/ch]
I had to find the passage back to place I was before
[ch]G[/ch]                                   [ch]D[/ch]
"Relax" said the night man, "We are programmed to receive.
[ch]Em[/ch]                                   [ch]F#7[/ch]
You can check out any time you like, but you can never leave".

For the song play each chords 7 times in a strumming pattern like this:
CHORDS:DDUUDUD

Just before your about to change the chord strum down twice then change.
D=Strum Down
U=Strum Up

So really the strumming pattern is this:
DDUUDUD...DD.

content.text:
Hotel California is the title song from the Eagles' album of the same name and was
released as a single in February 1977. Three months after its release, the single
was certified Gold by the Recording Industry Association of America. The Eagles
also won the 1977 Grammy Award for Record of the Year for "Hotel California" at
the 20th Grammy Awards in 1978. The song is rated highly in many rock music lists
and polls; Rolling Stone magazine ranked it number 49 on its list of "The 500
Greatest Songs of All Time".

content.text:
House of the Rising Sun - The Animals 

Tab by Nathan Lambert, based on the tab by Chayes.

I made the tab more compact so I could see the lyrics better, but I left the
intro chords as an example of the picking pattern. The *'s are where you should
be keeping time somehow! In the comments section of another tab, some people said
they were having trouble with the "extra" notes, so I put those in parentheses ().
Playing them does sound more like the song, but people probably won't notice if
you leave them out ;)  I also fixed how the chords lined up with the lyrics to
something that makes more sense to me. Hope this helps someone. Cheers!

No capo

content.text:
â€˜Under the Bridgeâ€™ by Red Hot Chili Peppers, released on September 24, 1991. The song was written by Vocalist 
Anthony Kiedis, the rest of the band wrote the music. The song expresses the feelings of loneliness and 
despondency, and to reflect on narcotics and their impact on his life. Kiedis initially did not feel 
"Under the Bridge" would fit into the Chili Peppers' repertoire and was reluctant to show it to his band mates 
until producer Rick Rubin implored him to do so. The song became a critical and commercial success, peaking at 
number two on the Billboard Hot 100 and later certified platinum by the Recording Industry Association of 
America. David Fricke of Rolling Stone said the song "unexpectedly drop-kicked the band into the Top 10", while 
Philip Booth of The Tampa Tribune commented that it was a "pretty, undulating, and by-now omnipresent single." 
Its success led in part to the departure of guitarist John Frusciante, who preferred the band to remain 
underground. â€˜Under the Bridgeâ€™ follows â€˜Give It Awayâ€™ as the band's second most performed live song, having 
been performed over 600 times.
